word:
The worker for God is not left without a pattern. He is given an example which, if followed, will make him a spectacle to the world, to angels, and to men. He is bidden to glorify God by carrying out unselfish aims and purposes. 
                                                                           135
Ms 84, 1904, pp. 3, 4. ("The Melrose Sanitarium," August 21, 1904.)
